intro: Astragalus dipodurus, commonly known as the two-toed milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Astragalus dipodurus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
